summary: The Russo-Ukrainian War started in 2014 when Russia took over Crimea and supported rebels in eastern Ukraine. Tensions rose in 2022 when Russia invaded Ukraine, causing a huge crisis. Russia wanted to stop Ukraine from joining NATO and claimed it wanted to "demilitarize" the country. Many countries condemned Russia and helped Ukraine. Ukraine has been fighting back and taking back some areas, but the war is still going on, with both sides attacking each other's territory. The International Criminal Court is investigating war crimes.
title: Russo-Ukrainian War
